task.title: Use Riak CS
task.shortdesc: This topic describes how to configure Riak CS as the object storage backend provider for the Object Storage Gateway (OSG).

ul.li: Successful completion of all the install sections prior to this section.
The UFS must be registered and enabled.
You must have a functioning Riak CS cluster.
You must execute the steps below as a Eucalyptus administrator.

prereq.p: For more information on Riak CS, see the Riak CS documentation.

context.b: To configure Riak CS object storage for the OSG

step.cmd: Enter riakcs as the storage provider using the euctl command.
Specify the RiakCS/S3 endpoint that you want to use with Eucalyptus. For example:
Provide your RiakCS credentials to access your RiakCS installation:

info.codeblock: euctl objectstorage.s3provider.s3accesskey=<RiakCS access key> --region @localhost euctl objectstorage.s3provider.s3secretkey=<RiakCS secret key> --region @localhost

step.cmd: After successful configuration, check to ensure that the state of the OSG is ENABLED by running the euserv-describe-services command. For example:

info.codeblock: [root@g-26-03 ~]# euserv-describe-services -U http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Empyrean --show-headers SERVICE TYPE ZONE NAME STATE ... SERVICE objectstorage user-api-1 user-api-1.objectstorage enabled ...

info.p: If the state appears as DISABLED or BROKEN, check the cloud-*.log files in the /var/log/eucalyptus directory. A DISABLED state generally indicates that there is a problem with your network or credentials. See for more information.

result.p: The Riak CS backend and OSG are now ready for production.
